label: Romantic Partner
evidence: Mickey and Minnie have been portrayed as a romantic couple since their debut in Steamboat Willie (1928)

label: Best Friends
evidence: Mickey and Donald have appeared together in numerous cartoons and are established as close friends

label: Best Friends
evidence: Mickey and Goofy form part of the classic Disney trio with Donald Duck

label: Owner
evidence: Pluto is Mickey's pet dog, first appearing in The Chain Gang (1930)

label: Romantic Partner
evidence: Daisy was introduced as Donald's girlfriend in Mr. Duck Steps Out (1940)

label: Created
evidence: Walt Disney co-created Mickey Mouse with Ub Iwerks in 1928

label: Created
evidence: Ub Iwerks designed Mickey Mouse's appearance and animated Steamboat Willie

label: Business Partners
evidence: Walt Disney and Ub Iwerks worked together at the Laugh-O-Gram Studio and later founded Disney Brothers Cartoon Studio
Walt Disney co-founded Disney Brothers Cartoon Studio (later The Walt Disney Company) with his brother Roy in 1923
Walt Disney worked at his studio in Burbank until his death in 1966

label: Debut Appearance
evidence: Steamboat Willie marked Mickey Mouse's first public appearance

label: Stars In
evidence: Mickey Mouse appears as the Sorcerer's Apprentice in the Fantasia segment
Mickey is the de facto leader of the Sensational Six
Minnie is a core member of the Sensational Six
Donald is a core member of the Sensational Six
Goofy is a core member of the Sensational Six
Pluto is a core member of the Sensational Six

label: Owned By
evidence: Disneyland was conceived and built by Walt Disney and is owned by The Walt Disney Company

label: Created & Visited
evidence: Walt Disney personally oversaw the creation of Disneyland and was a frequent visitor

label: Featured In
evidence: The Mickey Mouse Club was named after and featured Mickey Mouse as its mascot
